intro: Saussurea jacea, commonly known as the Tibetan yellowhead, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and yellow to orange flower heads. The plant produces small, inconspicuous florets arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually basal and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Saussurea jacea is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
